generated_json.title: HPI Spencer
content: A 54-year-old female journalist presents with a history of a right ring finger injury sustained on 7/2025 after falling while walking her dog. She reports swelling in the right index, middle, and ring fingers, along with a history of catching and curvature of the PIP joint of the left middle finger. She notes morning stiffness in the affected fingers, difficulty uncurling them, and weakness in the left hand. She reports a prior episode of trigger finger in the left middle finger that resolved with OT and exercises. The current issue began after the fall, with persistent swelling and stiffness, particularly in the morning. She has no pain but is concerned about functional limitations, especially with writing and typing. She underwent X-rays on 7/22/25 at Kaiser, which showed no acute fracture or dislocation, normal bone quality, and no severe degenerative changes. She has a history of mild carpal tunnel syndrome and frozen shoulder in her 40s, both resolved. She denies prior trigger finger but notes morning hand clenching and stress. She has been doing home exercises and night splinting. She switched insurance and sought care at this clinic after initial evaluation by a GP and OT.
generated_json.instruction: Summarize the History of Present Illness (HPI) as a single coherent paragraph in professional clinical note style. Include only details explicitly stated in the transcript about onset, duration, location, severity, mechanism of injury, treatments received, and progression of symptoms. Maintain chronological order from initial event to current status. Exclude exam findings, physical measurements, imaging, or other objective observations. Do not infer or assume information. Use full sentences, proper grammar, and clear narrative style, reflecting only what is explicitly reported.

generated_json.title: Imaging Results
content: X-ray normal, no acute fracture or dislocation, normal bone quality, no severe degenerative changes

If the doctor reports imaging as normal, return it as stated (e.g., 'X-ray normal'). If imaging was not performed or not mentioned, return the default value.

generated_json.title: Assessment
content: - Right hand sprain status post fall
generated_json.instruction: Generate the patient's Assessment as a concise list of active problems or conditions relevant to this visit. Rules: - Include both symptom-based problems (e.g., 'hand pain') and diagnosis-based terms (e.g., 'trigger finger'). - Exclude normal findings (e.g., 'skin is intact') and negative statements (e.g., 'no tenderness'). - Include 'status post' only if it describes an ongoing issue (e.g., 'stiff finger after surgery'). - Keep terms short and scribe-style, without exam details or explanations. - Format strictly as a list (one item per line, dash or bullet). - If no active conditions are present, return the default value.

generated_json.title: Plan
content: Trigger finger on left middle finger: patient elected to proceed with corticosteroid injection, which was performed today.
Right hand sprain: continue with stretching exercises; full resolution may take several more months.
Return to clinic if persistent symptoms develop.
generated_json.instruction: Write the doctor's plan exactly as dictated in the transcript, in scribe-style summary form. Rules: - Include only treatments, therapies, medications, imaging, education, or follow-up instructions explicitly mentioned. - Do not add or assume any details (e.g., do not invent follow-up times unless stated). - If follow-up is specified, include it exactly as dictated (e.g., 'return to clinic in 4 weeks'). - Use short sentences or numbered/bulleted steps. - If no plan is mentioned, return the default value.
